You can read!
Let it be known throughout the land that you are literate!
Learn to read
Nobody wants to teach you how to read. They think it's hopeless...
You found a scholar who agreed to teach you how to read for
{GOLD_ICON} per hour.
Let's do this!
Not enough gold
{GOLD_ICON} per hour.
Maybe next time...

The scholar begins by introducing the concept of the alphabet and the sounds each letter makes. He moves on to basic words and teaches how to pronounce them, as well as how to read them in context. The scholar emphasizes the importance of pronunciation and enunciation to accurately read and understand texts.
Not enough gold to continue learning...
Stop for now
Learn to read
Local villagers look confused. After a short talk between themselves, the brightest of them points towards the town...
Learn to read
Locals look puzzled. After scratching their heads they suggest you should go to the town...
Manage your education
Test popup
You are awesome!
You smart-ass skill increased by 10000!

Not enough gold...
5 {GOLD_ICON}
Yeah, saw {VENDOR.FIRSTNAME} recently. Look around the town.
I heard you can find what you are looking for in {SETTLEMENT}.
No, haven't heard lately.
Anything else?
I would like to see what you have
Not enough gold...
I don't need anything else for now. Bye.
Pleasure doing business with you. [ib:hip][rb:positive][rf:happy]
Found everything you need? [ib:hip][rb:positive][rf:happy]
Satisfied? [ib:hip][rb:negative][if:angry]
Thank you!
Can I help you with anything else? [ib:confident][if:convo_calm_friendly]
Anything else? [ib:confident][if:convo_calm_friendly]
What else? [ib:hip][if:angry]
Good sir, I was hoping to purchase a book, and I was wondering if you have seen any book vendors in the area. Have any passed through your establishment recently?
Pray, kind sir, have you had any news of any book vendors traveling in the vicinity? I am in search of some new reading material.
Excuse me, good sir. I am a bibliophile and I am on the lookout for a book vendor. Have any such merchants come through your establishment recently?
My good man, I am in need of a book and was hoping to find a vendor nearby. Might you have seen any such tradespeople in recent days?
Hail, sir. I am a lover of books and am seeking to purchase one. Would you happen to know of any book vendors that have passed through here lately?
Greetings, sir. I am in quest of a book and I was wondering if you have come across any book vendors recently. I would be much obliged if you could assist me in my search.
Might you be so kind as to inform me, good sir, if any book vendors have been seen in these parts recently? I am eager to add to my collection.
Good day, sir. I am in need of a book, and I was hoping to find a vendor nearby. Have you heard of any such merchants traveling in the area?
I hope this finds you well, sir. I am a passionate reader and I am searching for a book vendor. Have any such individuals come to your establishment in recent times?
Excuse me, sir. I am a scholar and I am in need of some new reading material. Have you seen any book vendors around these parts lately?
Good sir, I was hoping to expand my library, and I was wondering if you have seen any book vendors in the area recently. Any information you could provide would be greatly appreciated.
We don't have a book we were reading before...
Reading
LT_Education: Can't create book vendors... Reinstall mod manually.
You must provide an argument
Debug enabled
Debug disabled
Good morrow, sir! It is my pleasure to welcome you to my humble stall.
Greetings, my good man! Welcome to peruse the literary treasures I have to offer.
Well met, my friend! I am delighted to welcome you to the finest collection of books in all the land.
Hail to thee, noble sir! You are most welcome to explore the riches of my books.
Welcome, good sir! It is an honor to have you peruse my selection of tomes.
Greetings, kind sir! I bid you welcome to my humble stall, where knowledge and wonder await.
Good day to you, my good fellow! Welcome to indulge in the knowledge and entertainment my books provide.
Salutations, my esteemed patron! It is my pleasure to welcome you to my collection of fine literature.
Well met, good sir! Welcome to explore the literary delights that await you.
Greetings, my dear sir! I am honored to welcome you to my stall, where you'll find a wealth of knowledge and wisdom
Good morrow, madam! It is my pleasure to welcome you to my humble stall
Greetings, fair lady! Welcome to peruse the literary treasures I have to offer
Well met, my lady! I am delighted to welcome you to the finest collection of books in all the land
Hail to thee, noble madam! You are most welcome to explore the riches of my books.
Welcome, fair maiden! It is an honor to have you peruse my selection of tomes.
Greetings, kind lady! I bid you welcome to my humble stall, where knowledge and wonder await.
Good day to you, my dear lady! Welcome to indulge in the knowledge and entertainment my books provide.
Salutations, my esteemed patroness! It is my pleasure to welcome you to my collection of fine literature.
Well met, fair damsel! Welcome to explore the literary delights that await you.
Greetings, my dear lady! I am honored to welcome you to my stall, where you'll find a wealth of knowledge and wisdom.
Welcome, good sir! May I interest you in a book on chivalry? I believe it would be a perfect match for a knight as handsome as yourself.
Greetings, my lord! Your presence here has made my day brighter than the sun itself
My good sir, it seems as though the stars have aligned today, for I have the pleasure of meeting a man as gallant as yourself.
Blessed be the day I set eyes upon you, my lord. How may I be of service to you today?
Good day, kind sir! If only the pages of my books could be as charming as your smile.
What a pleasure it is to see a man of such taste and refinement browsing my humble collection of literature
You must be a scholar, my lord, for only a man of great intellect could appreciate the beauty of my books as much as you do.
It is said that knowledge is power, but I would argue that the real power lies in the company of a handsome gentleman such as yourself.
I must confess, my lord, that I have been waiting for a man of your caliber to visit my humble bookshop for some time now.
You must be a man of great discernment to have found your way to my little corner of the world. Might I suggest a volume on the art of courtly love to match your own romantic nature?
Welcome, fair lady! You grace my humble bookshop with your beauty and charm.
It is an honor to serve a woman of such refinement and grace. Might I recommend a volume on the art of courtly love to match your own romantic nature?
My lady, I cannot help but be struck by your radiance. Please allow me to assist you in finding the perfect book to match your brilliance.
It is rare to find a woman with such discerning taste as yourself. I am eager to show you the treasures within my collection.
What a delight it is to see a woman of your stature in my bookshop! Allow me to introduce you to some of the finest literature in the land.
My lady, your presence here is like a breath of fresh air. Might I interest you in a book on poetry to match your own lyrical beauty?
I have never seen a woman with such elegance and grace as yourself. I would be honored to assist you in finding the perfect volume to match your sophistication.
It is clear that you are a woman of great intellect and wisdom. Might I suggest a tome on philosophy or theology to match your own sharp mind?
My lady, I cannot help but be captivated by your charm and charisma. Please allow me to be your guide in this literary journey.
What a pleasure it is to see a woman of your beauty and intelligence in my humble bookshop. Might I suggest a volume on history to match your own knowledge and wisdom?
What do you want, knave? Speak quickly, for I have better things to do than listen to your prattle.
Who disturbs me from my rest? State your business or be gone, lest I set my dogs upon you.
What brings you to my humble establishment, wretch? If it is coin you seek, know that I demand payment up front.
Speak plainly, for I have no patience for those who waste my time with idle chatter. What do you desire?
What is it you seek, traveler? Speak quickly, for my temper grows short with every passing moment.
Greetings, stranger. What business have you with me? Make it brief, for I am not in the mood for company.
Who dares disturb my peace? Speak your mind or leave me to my thoughts.
What brings you to my doorstep, fool? State your business, or I shall have my guards remove you.
Well met, traveler. State your purpose or be on your way. I have no patience for aimless wanderers.
What do you want, peasant? I am not in the mood for pleasantries. Speak quickly and be on your way.
What do you want, wench? Speak quickly, for I have no time for idle chatter.
Who are you to disturb me? State your business or face the consequences.
What brings you to my doorstep, maiden? If it is coin you seek, be prepared to pay a fair price.
Speak plainly, for I have no patience for those who prattle on. What is it you desire?
What do you seek, woman? Speak quickly, for I have more important matters to attend to.
Greetings, fair lady. What business have you with me? Make it brief, for my time is precious.
Who dares to interrupt my solitude? Speak your mind or be on your way.
What brings you here, girl? State your purpose or risk facing my wrath.
Well met, traveler. What is it that you seek? Speak quickly and be on your way.
What do you want, harlot? I have no time for your games. State your business and be gone.
Farewell, good sir! I thank you for gracing my stall with your presence.
Adieu, my friend! May the knowledge you've acquired from my books enrich your life.
Farewell, my dear sir! It was a pleasure to assist you in your quest for knowledge.
Godspeed, noble sir! I bid you farewell and hope to see you again soon.
Farewell, my good man! I thank you for your patronage and bid you a safe journey.
May the blessings of the Almighty be upon you, my friend! Farewell, and happy reading.
Fare thee well, kind sir! I hope the books you've acquired bring you much joy and enlightenment.
May your thirst for knowledge never be quenched, my dear sir! Farewell, and may you find what you seek.
Farewell, my esteemed patron! It was an honor to serve you and share my love of books with you.
Goodbye, my dear sir! I bid you farewell with the hope that my books will bring you many hours of joy and learning.
Farewell, fair lady! I thank you for gracing my stall with your presence.
Adieu, my dear madam! May the knowledge you've acquired from my books enrich your life.
Farewell, my esteemed patroness! It was a pleasure to assist you in your quest for knowledge.
Godspeed, noble lady! I bid you farewell and hope to see you again soon.
Farewell, my kind lady! I thank you for your patronage and bid you a safe journey.
May the blessings of the Almighty be upon you, my dear lady! Farewell, and happy reading.
Fare thee well, fair maiden! I hope the books you've acquired bring you much joy and enlightenment.
May your thirst for knowledge never be quenched, my dear lady! Farewell, and may you find what you seek.
Farewell, my dear lady! It was an honor to serve you and share my love of books with you
Goodbye, my esteemed patroness! I bid you farewell with the hope that my books will bring you many hours of joy and learning.
Farewell, good sir! I hope you will visit me again soon, so that we may continue our discussions of literature and romance.
Until we meet again, my lord. May your heart be as full of joy as your mind is full of knowledge.
It has been a pleasure serving you, my gallant knight. I shall look forward to the day when you return to my humble bookshop.
I bid you adieu, my lord. May your journey be as bright and fulfilling as the pages of the books you so avidly peruse.
Until next time, my good sir. May the knowledge you have gleaned from my books serve you well in all your endeavors.
Farewell, my lord. Remember that my bookshop is always open to a man of your taste and refinement.
It has been an honor serving a man of your stature and grace. May your travels be safe and your mind be ever expanded by the words within my books.
Until we meet again, my lord. May the beauty and wisdom within my books be a constant source of inspiration for you.
I shall miss your charming company, my dear sir. May the lessons you have learned within my books serve you well on your journey through life.
Farewell, my lord. Know that the memory of your presence here shall linger within my heart like the fragrance of the roses in my garden.
Farewell, fair lady! May the pages of the books you have selected be as enlightening and beautiful as your own countenance.
Until we meet again, my lady. May the knowledge you have gained within my books serve to further enhance your already sparkling intellect.
It has been a pleasure serving a woman of such elegance and grace. May the journey of life bring you as much joy as your presence here has brought me.
I bid you adieu, my lady. May the romance and passion within my books inspire you to ever greater heights of love and devotion
Until next time, my dear lady. May the words within my books continue to kindle the fires of your own creativity and inspiration.
Farewell, fair maiden. Remember that my bookshop is always open to a woman of your beauty and discerning taste.
It has been an honor serving you, my lady. May the lessons within my books guide you on your journey through life with ever greater wisdom and insight.
Until we meet again, my lady. May the knowledge and beauty within my books serve as a constant source of inspiration for your own life and endeavors.
I shall miss your charming company, my dear lady. May the memories of our conversations and the knowledge within my books be a constant comfort to you.
Farewell, my lady. Know that the beauty and radiance of your presence here shall remain within my heart like the glow of the stars in the night sky...
Depart swiftly from my sight, you pestilent rat!
Away with you, you foul and contemptuous knave!
May the devil take you quickly, and swiftly at that!
I bid you farewell, but do not return to my establishment!
Leave at once, and may you never darken my doorway again!
Take your leave without delay, before I take my own.
Your company has grown increasingly tiresome, away with you, and quickly!
Be gone from my sight, before I summon the guards to remove you!
May the road you travel be long and arduous for you, and may you not find rest!
I care not where you go, so long as it is far away from my presence!
